summary: Email chain between Paul Cassell and an unnamed recipient discussing potential T-visa assistance for a woman possibly connected to the Epstein case who is stuck in Toronto. The emails explore legal options for her entry into the U.S. and mention cooperation with law enforcement.

persons.name: Paul Cassell
persons.context: Initiates the email chain seeking help for a woman potentially connected to Epstein who is stuck in Toronto and needs a T-visa to enter the U.S.

persons.name: Annie
persons.context: Mentioned as a coordinator in the office who provided information about T-visas and entry requirements.

connections.description: Paul Cassell contacts Annie's office for guidance on T-visa matters for a potential Epstein victim.

events.title: Initial T-visa inquiry
events.description: Paul Cassell emails seeking help for a woman possibly connected to Epstein who is stuck in Toronto and needs a T-visa to enter the U.S.

events.title: Follow-up on T-visa options
events.description: Follow-up email provides clarification that T-visas are for staying in the U.S., not entering, and discusses potential options if cooperating with U.S. law enforcement.

keyFacts: A woman potentially connected to the Epstein case is stuck in Toronto and seeking a T-visa to enter the United States.
T-visas are clarified as being for staying in the U.S., not for entry, complicating her situation.
Cooperation with U.S. law enforcement is mentioned as a potential pathway for entry.
The woman's connection to Epstein is described as not definitively established but possible.
The case appears stuck in limbo with referrals to law-enforcement agencies.
